sentences.sContent: Our decision to build the museum in Hartlepool was influenced by the fact that there were no national museums in the North East.
sentences.sCn: 我们之所以决定在哈特尔浦建造博物馆，是因为东北地区没有国家级的博物馆。

sentences.sContent: ...it is indispensable that communication between doctor and patients should be strengthened due to the the fact that doctor-patient communication can be seen as a bridge of two-way communication between doctors and patients...
...How does the woman interpret the fact that the man was asked to help his colleagues with their work...
...it is an undeniable fact the state-owned business can provide a stable life for me...
...And the fact that they have a personal stake in the outcome makes them really pay attention...
...but the fact is that people report feeling happier after crying...
...though this ignores the fact that many disciplines in the humanities characterized as“soft” often...
...and the fact that they're now at the end of the hiring queue just don't make it sensible to invest in them...
...and the fact that I was turning 50...
...But the fact that such a violation is "unintentional" does not excuse the misconduct...
...But it’s a fact that informative speaking saves lives...

phrases.pCn: 事实和数字；准确的资料；确凿的事实
作为确切事实；确实地；确凿地
无可动摇的事实；铁的事实

words.tran: 派别；内讧；小集团；纪实小说

trans.tranOther: a piece of information that is known to be true
